metadata.title: CVE-2015-0561 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
asn1/lpp/lpp.cnf in the LPP dissector in Wireshark 1.10.x before 1.10.12and 1.12.x before 1.12.3 does not validate a certain index value, whichallows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds memoryaccess and application crash) via a crafted packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0561` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwireshark11 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwiretap8 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwsutil9 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
tshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark-common - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark-qt - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1').
